questions_1.question: Which of the following are correct about Master Chip Detector?
Options: The master chip detector (MCD) consists of three electrical contact surrounding a magnet and is bolted into a self-closing valve at the bottom of the oil tank.
The master chip detector (MCD) consists of two electrical contact surrounding a magnet and is bolted into a self-closing valve at the bottom of the oil tank.
The master chip detector (MCD) consists of two electrical contact surrounding a magnet and is bolted into a self-closing valve at the top of the oil tank.
The master chip detector (MCD) consists of five electrical contact surrounding a magnet and is bolted into a self-closing valve at the top of the oil tank.
questions_1.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_1.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "The master chip detector (MCD) consists of two electrical contact surrounding a magnet and is bolted into a self-closing valve at the bottom of the oil tank."
questions_1.partialFeedback:

The valid answer is "The master chip detector (MCD) consists of two electrical contact surrounding a magnet and is bolted into a self-closing valve at the bottom of the oil tank."
